cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles west of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, forecast to re-enter the north-western Caribbean, then turn north toward the Gulf of Mexico and the U.S. Gulf Coast late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northeastern Nicaragua (near Cabo Gracias a Dios)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane watch possible later for portions of the Yucatan Peninsula (far south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras (far south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America (Nicaragua, Honduras) Thursdayâ€“Friday, then U.S. central Gulf Coast this weekend
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at the Detroit-Wayne County Port based on current forecast
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (Great Lakes location, no tidal surge influence)
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring periods of rain early next week, but widespread totals are expected to stay below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban drainage flooding possible if remnants pass nearby, otherwise no significant tropical-cyclone related hazards expected
